column4: Adobe results beat Street view  shares rise
column5: Software maker Adobe Systems Inc released quarterly results that beat Wall Street projections  sending its shares up 3 percent.

column4: Amazon selling over 1 million Kindles a week
column5: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it is selling more than one million Kindle devices a week  an unusual disclosure from the largest Internet retailer that comes in the wake of some negative reviews of its new Kindle Fire tablet.

column4: Amgen names new CEO  raises quarterly dividend
column5: LOS ANGELES Amgen Inc   the world's largest biotechnology company  said Chief Executive Officer Kevin Sharer will retire next May  and be replaced by Chief Operating Officer Bob Bradway.

column4: Graphic book reimagines key time in Steve Jobs' life
column5: Another new book about late Apple co-founder Steve Jobs is hitting bookshelves next month  this one a graphic narrative exploring the innovator's spiritual development  the publishers announced on Wednesday.

column4: Boeing adds two 777 orders  reaches 200 in 2011
column5: Dec 15 Boeing said it had hit 200 orders for its 777 wide-body aircraft this year  extending an annual sales record for the long-range mini-jumbo after adding two more orders in the past week.

column4: FedEx profit beats Street  updating Boeing fleet
column5: FedEx Corp  beat its quarterly profit forecasts and is updating its fleet with fuel-efficient Boeing aircraft while delaying delivery of other new planes to cut overall costs  driving its shares up nearly 8 percent.

column4: FedEx orders 27 Boeing 767s in fleet upgrade
column5: FedEx Corp  said on Thursday it has ordered 27 new Boeing Co  767-300F aircraft worth $4.7 billion at list prices as it plans to retire some of its aging aircraft.

column4: Canada regulator keeps Arctic drilling provisions
column5: CALGARY  Alberta Canada's National Energy Board said on Thursday that any company that wants to drill for oil and gas in Arctic waters will need to demonstrate it has the capacity to sink a relief well in the same drilling season to cope with possible well blowouts.

column4: U.S. offshore drillers need new safety approach: panel
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. offshore oil and gas drillers need to take a more systematic approach to safety in all aspects of their operations to prevent another catastrophe like last year's massive Gulf of Mexico oil spill  a scientific panel said on Wednesday.

column4: Analysis: Chevron lawsuit flags Brazil investment risks
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO A $10.6 billion lawsuit against U.S. oil company Chevron  and rig contractor Transocean  could further cool an increasingly chilly investment climate in Brazil's natural resources industry.

column4: Chevron committed to Brazil despite lawsuit: executive
column5: Chevron Corp  will stay the course in Brazil even as that country said it has filed a massive $11 billion lawsuit related to an offshore oil spill  a top company executive said on Thursday.

column5: SYDNEY  Dec 15 Chevron's Australia unit said on Thursday it has discovered natural gas in offshore Western Australia.

column4: Tata Motors global sales up 35 pct y/y in Nov
column5: Dec 15 Tata Motors' global vehicle sales rose an annual 35 percent in November  the company said in a statement on Thursday  with its luxury Jaguar Land Rover unit reporting a 27 percent rise in sales over the same period.

column5: CALGARY  Alberta Buoyed by renewed pledges of customer support  TransCanada Corp said on Thursday it not only wants to proceed with its stalled Canada-to-Texas Keystone XL oil pipeline but to undertake a $600 million expansion and extension.
